content: On July 18, 1995, the Atlanta Braves celebrated a significant moment in their season with a thrilling 4-3 victory over the San Diego Padres. This game was notable for Fred McGriff hitting a game-winning home run in the bottom of the eighth inning, adding to his impressive season total. The win helped solidify the Braves' position as they marched towards their eventual World Series championship that year, marking a pivotal point in their successful run throughout the 1990s.
